intro: Chaetocalyx hebecarpus, commonly known as the woolly evergreen hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and often covered in fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
